body.p:
The Model Context Protocol preferences panel, found in
Options Preferences Plugins Oxygen AI Positron Assistant Model Context Protocol , provides configuration options for connecting Oxygen AI Positron Assistant to external tools and data sources using the Anthropic Model Context Protocol (MCP).

dlentry.dd: Specifies the path to the MCP configuration file (for example, ${pd}/positron-ai-actions/mcp-config.json). This file defines the available MCP tools and their settings. Use the folder icon to browse for a file, or enter the path manually. A link to Configuration file structure is provided for reference.
Sets the maximum time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to an MCP server before timing out. The default value is 10 seconds.
If selected, enables the use of MCP servers running on the local machine. This is useful for development or testing scenarios where a local MCP server is available.

dlentry.dt: Add provided tools to all chat modes
dlentry.dd: If selected, the tools defined in the MCP configuration file are made available in all chat modes of the AI Positron Assistant.
Displays the current status of the MCP configuration and connection. For example, if the configuration file is not found, an error message is shown with the file path.

dlentry.dt: Allow running the Oxygen XML application as a local MCP server (Experimental)
dlentry.dd: If selected, allows the Oxygen XML application itself to act as a local MCP server. This is an experimental feature and may be subject to change.
Choose whether the settings apply globally to all projects or only to the current project.

body.p: Restore Defaults resets all options to their default values. Use OK to save changes, Cancel to discard them, or Apply to apply changes without closing the dialog.
